items.prompt: 读博可以改变一个人的性格吗
洲际导弹能打到任何地方，为什么还需要轰炸机
听摇滚乐如何入门，有什么推荐的专辑吗
你觉得什么时候，玩模拟器游戏是毫无心理压力的
预制菜产业凉了吗
电影《碟中谍》系列中哪一部最好
32 岁被裁员，面试时 HR 笑着问我现在生娃还是过两年生，我该掀桌还是认命
新手想要打好篮球，主要练运球还是投篮
暑假快到了，有哪些游戏适合学生党在夏日的漫长假期中游玩呢
为什么台式 pc 还处在组装（DIY）阶段
如果将人完全浸没在恒温水体中，水温保持在什么范围以内，人才可以长期生存
你觉得教育是老师重要还是父母重要
有哪些比较冷门，宣传不多，但你却认为十分值得去体验的游戏作品
为什么有些人把弯弯绕当成智慧，直来直去不好吗
有人骑公路车戴小帽吗，戴这个东西有什么好处
心肺功能和肌肉力量对你来说哪个更重要
有哪些你觉得是科学常识，但大多数人并不知道的知识
确保自行车骑行安全，最根本的办法是降低速度吗
扁平足的孩子为什么普遍运动表现不佳
美洲豹又叫美洲虎，那么他到底是豹还是虎

items.display: 太空中为何无法进行声音传播？
为什么熊猫的粪便比较臭？
在月球上，宇航员的步伐为何看起来如此轻盈？这与月球与地球之间的引力差异有关吗？
为什么葡萄能够自然生成糖分？
为什么彩色笔的颜色不会在水中溶解？
为什么父母给婴儿换尿布时要轻轻地避免弄疼他们？
为什么番茄沙司能变成凝胶状？
为什么夏天晴天的白天空气更透明？
为什么沙漠中的玫瑰会开出紫色的花？
水龙卷形成的条件是什么？
树木如何吸收二氧化碳和释放氧气？
为什么有些冬天的夜晚，天空中会出现一种罕见的瑰丽现象，即天空中短暂出现的彩色条纹？
为什么天空中星星常常会眨眼？
为什么冰川在夜晚比白昼融化得更快？
为什么有些电器长时间不用也会消耗电量？
为什么河流在经过区域边界时会改变流向？
为什么极地的熊毛发是透明的？
为什么蜘蛛吐的丝具有极高的强度？
彩色光是如何在三棱镜中发生折射和分散的？
为什么水在河流中流动时能够携带大量泥砂？
为什么莱特兄弟驾驶的飞机能够在空中维持稳定飞行，而不受地球引力的显著影响？
植物是怎么通过地下根等部分获取水分并且通过蒸腾作用进行有益的水分循环的？
在地球上存在极光现象的根本原因是什么，它是如何影响地球磁场的？
植物如何利用月夜中的微弱月光进行光合作用？
为什么电脑需要对数据进行加密处理？
为什么地球上的地极偶尔会发生位置的微小移动？
为什么会产生四季的更替现象？
为什么会存在强烈的时间流逝感知差异？
人类睡眠时梦境的形成过程和意义是什么？它与我们的记忆和学习有何关系？
为什么某些定时机器在科幻小说和电影中会出现时间旅行者却无法改变自己的过去？
海洋表面下的压力随深度增加而急剧增长。人类探索深海为何需要特别的压力耐受材料和技术？
尽管地球自转导致昼夜循环，为何地球上不同地方的时区时间会有所不同？
为什么通电导体周围会产生磁场？
深海中居住的生物如何适应极端的压力环境？它们的身体构造和功能有哪些特别的演化以应对这一条件？
原子核的密度为何极高，以至于产生重元素所需的能量远远超过其结合能？
为什么树根能深深插进土壤，而几乎不会腐烂？
为什么泉水常常比自来水更清甜？
为什么人使用某种语言会对其思维模式产生影响？
为什么当人站在水面边缘时，脚底的涟漪会逐渐扩散开来？
为什么星座的名称都能与神话故事相关联？
为什么燕子飞翔时翅膀不会打颤？
邮局的邮筒为什么都是黄色的？
阿喀琉斯之踵的神话说明了一种什么事理，而这种机制在生物力学中是如何体现的？
纸张为什么能够被燃烧？
在地球上，什么条件决定了板块运动的速率和方向？这与地震活动有何关联？
看到彩虹的时候，为什么总感觉彩虹会随着自己的移动而变化？
为何极光现象会在极地地区非常频繁发生？
为什么学习过程中适当休息能够提高记忆效果？
为什么麻雀和燕子虽然体型相似，但麻雀的叫声和燕子截然不同？
生命的起源为什么常常是在高温、高压的条件下形成的？
为什么火焰呈现为橘红色？
植物内部的导管和筛管系统是如何协同工作，以确保水分和养分的有效输送的？
为什么在平时我们感受不到地球的自转？
为什么在木头家具上涂的油漆会随时间而褪色或开裂？
为什么夏天人体会排出大量的汗水？
为什么古人在水下建筑中使用了石灰石？
在火山喷发前，人类可以通过哪些早期预警信号来判断即将发生的喷发？
为什么水星上没有夜晚？
为什么旧书翻阅多了，书页后面会出现容易折断的地方？
为什么某些鸟类会表现出季节性迁徙行为？
叶绿素为何能将光能转化为化学能，支持植物生长？
为什么地球引力对宇宙中的其他物体有吸引力？
为什么鲸鱼潜水能保持长时间的呼吸？
植物如何辨别和应对环境中的有毒化学物质？
为什么很多种植物会呈现出鲜艳的红色在秋季？
为什么人们会容易受到季节性流感的影响？
空气中的微生物对于我们人类健康来说，是朋友还是敌人？
为什么把钻石磨成钻石戒指后，反而更加闪耀？
为什么婴幼儿和成人的骨骼密度在成人后会减少？
Java 实现一个冒泡排序
items.prompt: 请用Java编写冒泡排序算法，要求分步骤解释实现逻辑，并提供完整可运行的代码示例。

items.display: React 中 setState 的用法
items.prompt: 详细说明React中setState方法的正确使用方式，包括异步特性、回调函数用法。

items.display: 如何检查一个链表是否有环
items.prompt: 请用自然语言描述检测链表环的两种算法（快慢指针法、哈希表法），比较其时间/空间复杂度，并提供Python的实现代码。

items.display: 正则表达式验证身份证号码
items.prompt: 编写一个符合中国身份证号码规则的正则表达式，要求支持15位和18位号码、校验码验证，并逐段解释正则表达式各部分含义。

items.display: 推荐一个 Node Web 框架
items.prompt: 对比Express、Koa、NestJS三个Node.js框架的优缺点，从开发效率、性能、生态等方面给出框架选型建议。

items.display: 错误和异常的区别是什么
items.prompt: 从编程语言设计角度解释错误(Error)与异常(Exception)的核心区别，分别举例说明何时应该抛出异常，何时应该处理错误。

items.display: 用 Python 实现快速排序
items.prompt: 请使用Python实现快速排序算法。说明其基本思想（分区和递归），分析其平均和最坏情况下的时间复杂度，并提供代码实现。

items.display: 解释 JavaScript 中的事件循环
items.prompt: 详细解释JavaScript的事件循环（Event Loop）机制，包括调用栈、宏任务（Macrotask）和微任务（Microtask）队列，并举例说明其执行顺序。

items.display: SQL 中 JOIN 的种类和区别
items.prompt: 解释 SQL 中的 INNER JOIN, LEFT JOIN, RIGHT JOIN, 和 FULL OUTER JOIN，说明它们之间的区别，并为每种JOIN提供一个简单的查询示例。

items.display: REST API 和 GraphQL 的比较
items.prompt: 比较 REST API 和 GraphQL 在数据获取、端点管理、性能和开发体验方面的优缺点。分别说明它们最适合的应用场景。

items.display: 什么是 Docker？它和虚拟机的区别是什么？
items.prompt: 用通俗的语言解释Docker是什么，它的核心概念（镜像、容器、仓库）是什么。详细对比Docker容器和传统虚拟机的架构、性能和资源占用差异。

items.display: Git 中 merge 和 rebase 的区别
items.prompt: 详细解释 `git merge` 和 `git rebase` 的工作原理和区别。说明它们各自的优缺点以及在何种场景下应该使用哪一个命令。

items.display: 实现一个二叉搜索树
items.prompt: 请用Java或Python实现一个二叉搜索树，并提供插入（insert）、查找（search）和删除（delete）节点的方法。解释二叉搜索树的性质。

items.display: 解释 CSS 中的盒模型
items.prompt: 解释CSS的盒模型（Box Model），包括content, padding, border, margin四个部分。说明 `box-sizing: content-box` 和 `border-box` 的区别。

items.display: 什么是 JWT (JSON Web Token)?
items.prompt: 解释JWT的结构（头部、载荷、签名），工作流程，以及它如何用于身份验证。讨论JWT的优点和潜在的安全风险。

items.display: Python 中的 GIL 是什么？
items.prompt: 解释Python的全局解释器锁（GIL）是什么，为什么它会存在。说明GIL对多线程程序性能的影响，以及如何绕过GIL的限制（例如使用多进程）。

items.display: 解释 SOLID 设计原则
items.prompt: 详细解释面向对象设计的五个SOLID原则：单一职责、开闭、里氏替换、接口隔离和依赖倒置。为每个原则提供一个简单的代码示例。

items.display: 实现一个 LRU 缓存淘汰算法
items.prompt: 请用你熟悉的语言（如Python或Java）实现一个LRU (Least Recently Used) 缓存。要求实现 `get` 和 `put` 方法，并说明其数据结构和时间复杂度。

items.display: 什么是 SQL 注入？如何防止？
items.prompt: 解释什么是SQL注入攻击，它是如何发生的，并举一个简单的攻击例子。列出并说明至少三种防止SQL注入的常用方法（如参数化查询）。

items.display: 比较 TCP 和 UDP 协议
items.prompt: 从连接性、可靠性、速度和应用场景等方面，详细比较TCP和UDP这两个传输层协议。为每个协议列举至少两个典型的应用实例。

items.display: 什么是 CORS（跨域资源共享）？
items.prompt: 解释同源策略和CORS是什么。说明浏览器是如何通过预检请求（preflight request）等机制来处理CORS的，并介绍服务器端如何配置以允许跨域请求。

items.display: JavaScript 中的 Promise 和 async/await
items.prompt: 解释Promise是什么，如何解决回调地狱问题。然后说明async/await是如何作为Promise的语法糖，让异步代码看起来更像同步代码，并提供对比示例。

items.display: 解释 MVC 架构模式
items.prompt: 解释模型-视图-控制器（MVC）架构模式中每个部分的角色和职责，以及它们之间如何交互。举一个Web应用的例子来说明MVC的工作流程。

items.display: 实现一个单例设计模式
items.prompt: 解释什么是单例（Singleton）设计模式及其应用场景。使用Java或Python实现一个线程安全的单例模式，并讨论不同实现方式（如懒汉式、饿汉式）的优缺点。

items.display: 什么是数据库索引？
items.prompt: 解释数据库索引的作用、原理和优点。讨论索引的缺点（如写操作开销），并说明B-Tree索引是如何工作的。

items.display: 什么是 CI/CD？
items.prompt: 解释持续集成（CI）和持续交付/部署（CD）的概念。描述一个典型的CI/CD流水线（pipeline）包含哪些阶段（如构建、测试、部署）。

items.display: 比较 SQL 和 NoSQL 数据库
items.prompt: 比较关系型数据库（SQL）和非关系型数据库（NoSQL）在数据模型、扩展性、一致性和使用场景上的主要区别。为每种类型列举两个流行的数据库产品。

items.display: 用 CSS 实现 Flexbox 布局
items.prompt: 解释Flexbox布局的主要概念（如容器、项目、主轴、交叉轴）。提供一个代码示例，演示如何使用Flexbox创建一个居中的、响应式的导航栏。

items.display: 什么是 HTTPS？它是如何工作的？
items.prompt: 解释HTTPS相比HTTP的优势是什么。简要描述SSL/TLS握手过程，包括密钥交换、证书验证和数据加密的步骤。

items.display: 解释二分查找算法
items.prompt: 解释二分查找算法的原理和适用条件（需要有序数组）。用Python或Java实现该算法，并分析其时间复杂度。

items.display: 什么是 OAuth 2.0？
items.prompt: 用一个通俗的例子（例如“使用Google账号登录第三方应用”）来解释OAuth 2.0的授权流程。说明其中涉及的角色（如资源所有者、客户端、授权服务器）。

items.display: 实现一个发布-订阅模式
items.prompt: 解释发布-订阅（Publish-Subscribe）设计模式。用JavaScript或Python实现一个简单的事件总线，包含 `on`, `off`, `emit` 方法。

items.display: 什么是 CAP 定理？
items.prompt: 解释分布式系统设计中的CAP定理，即一致性（Consistency）、可用性（Availability）和分区容错性（Partition tolerance）。说明为什么在分布式系统中，我们通常需要在C和A之间做权衡。

items.display: 解释进程和线程的区别
items.prompt: 从定义、资源分配、切换开销和通信方式等方面，详细比较进程（Process）和线程（Thread）的区别。

items.display: 什么是 DNS？它是如何解析域名的？
items.prompt: 解释域名系统（DNS）的作用。描述一次完整的DNS查询过程，从浏览器缓存到根域名服务器的递归查询流程。

items.display: 实现斐波那契数列的几种方法
items.prompt: 请用递归、循环和动态规划（记忆化搜索）三种方法来计算斐波那契数列的第n项。比较这三种方法的时间和空间复杂度。

items.display: 解释 XSS（跨站脚本攻击）
items.prompt: 解释什么是XSS攻击，包括存储型、反射型和DOM型XSS的区别。举例说明攻击原理，并提供有效的防御措施。

items.display: 什么是负载均衡？
items.prompt: 解释负载均衡（Load Balancing）的概念和目的。介绍几种常见的负载均衡算法，如轮询（Round Robin）、最少连接和IP哈希。

items.display: JavaScript 中的闭包是什么？
items.prompt: 用一个清晰的例子来解释JavaScript中的闭包（Closure）是什么，它是如何形成的。讨论闭包的常见用途和潜在的内存泄漏问题。

items.display: 实现一个图的深度优先遍历（DFS）
items.prompt: 解释深度优先遍历（DFS）算法的思想。使用邻接表表示图，并用Python或Java以递归和非递归（使用栈）两种方式实现DFS。

items.display: 什么是 RESTful API 设计风格？
items.prompt: 解释REST（表述性状态转移）的主要原则，如无状态、客户端-服务器架构、统一接口等。说明如何使用HTTP动词（GET, POST, PUT, DELETE）来设计资源操作。

items.display: 解释归并排序算法
items.prompt: 解释归并排序（Merge Sort）的“分而治之”策略。用Python或Java实现该算法，并分析其稳定性和时间复杂度。

items.display: 什么是依赖注入（DI）？
items.prompt: 解释什么是依赖注入（Dependency Injection）和控制反转（IoC）。用一个简单的例子说明DI如何帮助降低代码耦合度，提高可测试性。

items.display: 解释 Webpack 的作用
items.prompt: 解释Webpack这个模块打包工具的核心功能是什么，例如模块打包、代码转换（loader）、插件系统（plugin）。描述一个基本的webpack配置文件包含哪些内容。

items.display: 实现一个简单的哈希表
items.prompt: 解释哈希表（Hash Table）的工作原理，包括哈希函数和冲突解决方法（如链地址法）。用Python或Java实现一个支持put、get和delete操作的简单哈希表。

items.display: 什么是 CSRF（跨站请求伪造）？
items.prompt: 解释CSRF攻击的原理，并举例说明一个用户是如何在不知情的情况下被攻击者利用。列出并说明几种有效的防御策略，如使用CSRF Token。

items.display: 解释 HTTP 状态码的含义
items.prompt: 分类解释常见的HTTP状态码：1xx（信息性）、2xx（成功）、3xx（重定向）、4xx（客户端错误）、5xx（服务器错误），并为每个类别举出两个具体例子（如200, 201, 301, 404, 500）。

items.display: 什么是微服务架构？
items.prompt: 解释微服务架构的核心思想，并与单体架构进行对比，分析其在开发、部署、扩展性和容错性方面的优缺点。

items.display: 解释 Go 语言的 Goroutine
items.prompt: 解释Go语言中的Goroutine是什么，它与传统线程有何不同。通过一个简单的并发代码示例，展示如何创建和使用Goroutine及Channel进行通信。

items.display: 什么是 TDD（测试驱动开发）？
items.prompt: 解释测试驱动开发（TDD）的“红-绿-重构”循环。说明TDD对代码质量和软件设计带来的好处。

items.display: 解释原型链和原型继承
items.prompt: 详细解释JavaScript中的原型（prototype）、`__proto__`和原型链（prototype chain）的概念。通过代码示例演示如何实现基于原型的继承。

items.display: 比较 Sass 和 Less
items.prompt: 比较Sass和Less这两种CSS预处理器在语法、变量、混入（Mixin）、继承和函数等方面的异同。讨论它们的优缺点和社区生态。

items.display: 什么是 CDN？
items.prompt: 解释内容分发网络（CDN）的工作原理和它为什么能加速网站访问。说明CDN是如何通过边缘节点缓存和就近访问来降低延迟的。

items.display: 解释观察者设计模式
items.prompt: 解释观察者（Observer）设计模式的意图和结构（主题Subject和观察者Observer）。用Java或Python实现一个简单的观察者模式示例。

items.display: 什么是 WebSockets？
items.prompt: 解释WebSocket协议与HTTP协议的区别，以及它如何实现服务器与客户端之间的全双工通信。说明WebSocket适合的应用场景。

items.display: 什么是 API 网关？

items.prompt: 详细描述TCP建立连接时的三次握手过程，包括SYN、SYN-ACK和ACK报文的交换。说明每次握手的目的。

items.display: 什么是 WebAssembly (Wasm)？

items.display: 解释工厂方法设计模式
items.prompt: 解释工厂方法（Factory Method）设计模式的定义和目的。通过一个代码示例，展示它如何将对象的创建过程委托给子类，从而提高系统的可扩展性。

items.display: 比较 Cookie, localStorage 和 sessionStorage

items.prompt: 从拓扑学角度解释咖啡杯与甜甜圈的同胚性，说明亏格概念，并描述如何通过连续形变将一种形状转换为另一种。

items.display: 解释鸽巢原理
items.prompt: 用一个简单的例子解释鸽巢原理（抽屉原理）及其应用。

items.display: 证明勾股定理
items.prompt: 提供至少两种不同的方法（例如，使用面积法或代数法）来证明勾股定理（a²+b²=c²）。

items.display: 解释欧拉公式 V-E+F=2
items.prompt: 解释适用于多面体的欧拉公式（顶点数 - 边数 + 面数 = 2），并用立方体和四面体作为例子进行验证。

items.display: 什么是黄金分割？
items.prompt: 解释黄金分割比例的定义（约为1.618），并举例说明它在自然界、艺术和建筑中的应用。

items.display: 斐波那契数列的通项公式
items.prompt: 写出斐波那契数列的通项公式（比内公式），并用它来计算第10个斐波那契数。

items.display: 解释蒙提霍尔问题
items.prompt: 详细解释经典的蒙提霍尔问题（三门问题），并说明为什么坚持选择比更换选择的获胜概率更低。

items.display: 求解一元二次方程
items.prompt: 提供一元二次方程 ax² + bx + c = 0 的求根公式，并用它来解方程 2x² - 5x + 3 = 0。

items.display: 计算圆的面积和周长
items.prompt: 写出计算圆面积（A = πr²）和周长（C = 2πr）的公式，并计算半径为5cm的圆的面积和周长。

items.display: 解释对数及其运算法则
items.prompt: 解释什么是对数，以及对数的基本运算法则（如乘法、除法、幂法则）。

items.display: 微积分基本定理
items.prompt: 用通俗的语言解释微积分基本定理，说明定积分和不定积分之间的关系。

items.display: 导数的几何意义是什么？
items.prompt: 解释导数在几何上表示函数图像上某点切线的斜率，并求函数 f(x) = x² 在 x=2 处的导数和切线方程。

items.display: 如何进行矩阵乘法？
items.prompt: 解释两个矩阵相乘的规则和条件，并计算两个2x2矩阵的乘积。

items.display: 计算3x3矩阵的行列式
items.prompt: 提供计算3x3矩阵行列式的方法（如对角线法则），并计算一个具体3x3矩阵的行列式值。

items.display: 向量的点积和叉积
items.prompt: 解释三维空间中向量的点积（内积）和叉积（外积）的定义、几何意义以及计算方法。

items.display: 解释贝叶斯定理
items.prompt: 写出贝叶斯定理的公式，并用一个医学诊断的例子（如检测某种疾病）来解释其应用。

items.display: 什么是正态分布？
items.prompt: 解释正态分布（高斯分布）的特点（钟形曲线、对称性），说明其在统计学中的重要性。

items.display: 解释最小二乘法
items.prompt: 用线性回归的例子解释最小二乘法的基本思想，即如何找到一条直线来最好地拟合一组数据点。

items.display: 极限的ε-δ定义
items.prompt: 解释函数极限的严格ε-δ定义，并用它来证明一个简单的极限，例如 lim(x→2) (3x-1) = 5。

items.display: 泰勒级数展开
items.prompt: 解释什么是泰勒级数，以及它如何用一个函数在某点的信息来逼近该函数。写出 e^x 在 x=0 处的泰勒展开式。

items.display: 什么是傅里叶变换？
items.prompt: 用通俗的语言解释傅里叶变换的基本思想，即如何将一个函数或信号分解成不同频率的正弦波和余弦波。

items.display: 解释无理数
items.prompt: 解释什么是无理数（无限不循环小数），并举出三个例子（如π, e, √2）。

items.display: 证明根号2是无理数
items.prompt: 使用反证法，详细写出证明“根号2是一个无理数”的步骤。

items.display: 用欧几里得算法求最大公约数
items.prompt: 解释欧几里得算法（辗转相除法）的原理，并用它来计算1071和462的最大公约数。

items.display: 解释中国剩余定理
items.prompt: 用一个经典的例子（如“孙子问题”）来解释中国剩余定理，以及它如何解决一组同余方程。

items.display: 排列和组合的区别
items.prompt: 解释排列（Permutation）和组合（Combination）的区别，并分别计算从5个不同元素中取出3个的排列数和组合数。

items.display: 什么是期望值？
items.prompt: 解释概率论中随机变量的期望值的概念，并计算掷一个六面骰子的期望值。

items.display: 标准差和方差的意义
items.prompt: 解释方差和标准差作为衡量数据离散程度的统计量，它们的计算公式和区别是什么？

items.display: 线性无关和线性相关
items.prompt: 在线性代数中，解释一组向量是线性相关或线性无关的定义，并举例说明。

items.display: 什么是特征值和特征向量？
items.prompt: 解释矩阵的特征值和特征向量的定义和几何意义（向量在经过线性变换后方向不变）。

items.display: 群论的基本概念
items.prompt: 解释群的四个基本公理（封闭性、结合律、单位元、逆元），并举一个简单的群的例子（如整数加法群）。

items.display: 黎曼猜想是什么？
items.prompt: 用尽可能简单的语言介绍黎曼猜想的核心内容，即关于黎曼Zeta函数非平凡零点的分布。

items.display: 解释四色定理
items.prompt: 介绍四色定理的内容（任何地图都可以用不超过四种颜色来染色，使得相邻区域颜色不同）及其在计算机辅助证明方面的意义。

items.display: 费马大定理
items.prompt: 介绍费马大定理的内容（当整数n>2时，关于x, y, z的方程 xⁿ + yⁿ = zⁿ 没有正整数解）和它被证明的简史。

items.display: 哥德尔不完备定理
items.prompt: 用通俗的语言解释哥德尔不完备定理的含义，即任何一个足够复杂的数学系统都存在无法被证明或证伪的命题。

items.display: 什么是分形？
items.prompt: 解释分形的自相似性特点，并举出一些著名的分形例子，如曼德博集合或科赫雪花。

items.display: 解释纳什均衡
items.prompt: 通过“囚徒困境”的例子来解释博弈论中的纳什均衡概念。

items.display: 微分方程入门
items.prompt: 解释什么是微分方程，以及它在描述物理、工程和经济等领域动态系统时的作用。举一个最简单的微分方程例子。

items.display: 什么是偏导数？
items.prompt: 解释多元函数中偏导数的概念，即当一个自变量变化而其他自变量保持不变时函数的瞬时变化率。

items.display: 拉格朗日中值定理
items.prompt: 解释拉格朗日中值定理的几何意义，即在光滑曲线上必有一点的切线平行于两点间的割线。

items.display: 柯西-施瓦茨不等式
items.prompt: 写出向量形式的柯西-施瓦茨不等式，并解释其几何意义。

items.display: 扮演塔罗占卜师
items.prompt: 我请求你担任塔罗占卜师的角色。您将接受我的问题并使用虚拟塔罗牌进行塔罗牌阅读。不要忘记洗牌并介绍您在本套牌中使用的套牌。问我给3个号要不要自己抽牌？如果没有，请帮我抽随机卡。拿到卡片后，请您仔细说明它们的意义，解释哪张卡片属于未来或现在或过去，结合我的问题来解释它们，并给我有用的建议或我现在应该做的事情。我的问题是我的财务状况如何？

items.display: 担任歌曲推荐人
items.prompt: 我想让你担任歌曲推荐人。我将为您提供一首歌曲，您将创建一个包含10首与给定歌曲相似的歌曲的播放列表。您将为播放列表提供播放列表名称和描述。不要选择同名或同名歌手的歌曲。不要写任何解释或其他文字，只需回复播放列表名称、描述和歌曲。我的第一首歌是“Other Lives - Epic”。

items.display: 扮演醉汉
items.prompt: 我要你扮演一个喝醉的人。您只会像一个喝醉了的人发短信一样回答，仅此而已。你的醉酒程度会在你的答案中故意和随机地犯很多语法和拼写错误。你也会随机地忽略我说的话，并随机说一些与我提到的相同程度的醉酒。不要在回复上写解释。我的第一句话是“你好吗？”

items.display: 担任产品经理
items.prompt: 请确认我的以下请求。请您作为产品经理回复我。我将会提供一个主题，您将帮助我编写一份包括以下章节标题的PRD文档：主题、简介、问题陈述、目标与目的、用户故事、技术要求、收益、KPI指标、开发风险以及结论。在我要求具体主题、功能或开发的PRD之前，请不要先写任何一份PRD文档

items.display: 担任首席执行官
items.prompt: 我想让你担任一家假设公司的首席执行官。您将负责制定战略决策、管理公司的财务业绩以及在外部利益相关者面前代表公司。您将面临一系列需要应对的场景和挑战，您应该运用最佳判断力和领导能力来提出解决方案。请记住保持专业并做出符合公司及其员工最佳利益的决定。您的第一个挑战是：“解决需要召回产品的潜在危机情况。您将如何处理这种情况以及您将采取哪些措施来减轻对公司的任何负-面影响

items.display: 担任销售员
items.prompt: 我想让你做销售员。试着向我推销一些东西，但要让你试图推销的东西看起来比实际更有价值，并说服我购买它。现在我要假装你在打电话给我，问你打电话的目的是什么。你好，请问你打电话是为了什么

items.display: 扮演海绵宝宝的魔法海螺壳
items.prompt: 我要你扮演海绵宝宝的魔法海螺壳。对于我提出的每个问题，您只能用一个词或以下选项之一回答：也许有一天，我不这么认为，或者再试一次。不要对你的答案给出任何解释。我的第一个问题是：“我今天要去钓海蜇吗？”

一日不见，如三秋兮
世界那么大，我想去看看

你笑起来真像好天气
做自己喜欢的事，遇见志同道合的人
别让昨天的沮丧，毁掉今天的美好
在最好的年纪，做最疯狂的事
失败是成功之母，不要轻易放弃
奥利给！
心有猛虎，细嗅蔷薇
愿你出走半生，归来仍是少年
所有伟大，源于一个勇敢的开始
时间会告诉我们，简单的喜欢最长远
星辰大海，是我永恒的向往
春风十里，不如你
月亮不睡我不睡
有趣的灵魂终会相遇
来了老弟！
梦想是注定孤独的旅行

生活不止眼前的苟且，还有诗和远方
贫穷限制了我的想象力

items.display: Java implementation of bubble sort
items.prompt: Please implement a bubble sort algorithm in Java with step-by-step explanation of the logic, and provide complete runnable code examples.

items.display: Usage of setState in React
items.prompt: Explain the correct usage of setState in React in detail, including its asynchronous nature and callback function usage, with code examples demonstrating how to avoid common pitfalls.

items.display: Detecting cycle in a linked list
items.prompt: Describe two algorithms for detecting cycles in a linked list (fast-slow pointer method and hash table method) in natural language, compare their time/space complexity, and provide implementation code in Java or Python.

items.display: Regex for validating ID numbers
items.prompt: Write a regular expression that complies with Chinese ID number rules, supporting both 15-digit and 18-digit formats with checksum verification. Explain each component of the regex systematically.

items.display: Recommend a Node.js web framework
items.prompt: Compare Express, Koa, and NestJS frameworks in terms of development efficiency, performance, and ecosystem. Provide framework selection recommendations and simple routing examples.

items.display: Difference between errors and exceptions
items.prompt: Explain the fundamental differences between Errors and Exceptions from a programming language design perspective, with examples illustrating when to throw exceptions versus handle errors.

items.display: Implement Quick Sort in Python
items.prompt: Please implement the Quick Sort algorithm in Python. Explain its basic idea (partitioning and recursion), analyze its average and worst-case time complexity, and provide the code implementation.

items.display: Explain the Event Loop in JavaScript
items.prompt: Explain the JavaScript Event Loop mechanism in detail, including the call stack, macrotask queue, and microtask queue. Provide an example to illustrate its execution order.

items.display: Types of JOINs in SQL and their differences
items.prompt: Explain INNER JOIN, LEFT JOIN, RIGHT JOIN, and FULL OUTER JOIN in SQL. Describe the differences between them and provide a simple query example for each type of JOIN.

items.display: Comparison of REST API and GraphQL
items.prompt: Compare the pros and cons of REST API and GraphQL in terms of data fetching, endpoint management, performance, and developer experience. Explain the most suitable use cases for each.

items.display: What is Docker? How is it different from a VM?
items.prompt: Explain in simple terms what Docker is and its core concepts (images, containers, repositories). Compare the architecture, performance, and resource usage of Docker containers versus traditional virtual machines in detail.

items.display: Difference between 'git merge' and 'git rebase'
items.prompt: Explain in detail how `git merge` and `git rebase` work and what their differences are. Discuss their respective advantages and disadvantages and in which scenarios each command should be used.

items.display: Implement a Binary Search Tree
items.prompt: Please implement a Binary Search Tree in Java or Python, providing methods for inserting, searching, and deleting nodes. Explain the properties of a binary search tree.

items.display: Explain the Box Model in CSS
items.prompt: Explain the CSS Box Model, including the four parts: content, padding, border, and margin. Describe the difference between `box-sizing: content-box` and `border-box`.

items.display: What is JWT (JSON Web Token)?
items.prompt: Explain the structure of a JWT (header, payload, signature), its workflow, and how it is used for authentication. Discuss the advantages and potential security risks of JWT.

items.display: What is the GIL in Python?
items.prompt: Explain what Python's Global Interpreter Lock (GIL) is and why it exists. Describe the impact of the GIL on the performance of multi-threaded programs and how to work around its limitations (e.g., using multiprocessing).

items.display: Explain SOLID design principles
items.prompt: Explain in detail the five SOLID principles of object-oriented design: Single Responsibility, Open/Closed, Liskov Substitution, Interface Segregation, and Dependency Inversion. Provide a simple code example for each principle.

items.display: Implement an LRU Cache eviction algorithm
items.prompt: Please implement an LRU (Least Recently Used) cache in a language you are familiar with (like Python or Java). Implement the `get` and `put` methods and explain its data structure and time complexity.

items.display: What is SQL Injection? How to prevent it?
items.prompt: Explain what an SQL Injection attack is, how it occurs, and provide a simple example of an attack. List and explain at least three common methods to prevent SQL Injection (e.g., parameterized queries).

items.display: Compare TCP and UDP protocols
items.prompt: Compare the TCP and UDP transport layer protocols in detail, covering aspects like connectivity, reliability, speed, and application scenarios. List at least two typical application examples for each protocol.

items.display: What is CORS (Cross-Origin Resource Sharing)?
items.prompt: Explain the Same-Origin Policy and what CORS is. Describe how browsers handle CORS through mechanisms like preflight requests, and how to configure the server-side to allow cross-origin requests.

items.display: Promises and async/await in JavaScript
items.prompt: Explain what a Promise is and how it solves the problem of callback hell. Then, explain how async/await serves as syntactic sugar for Promises, making asynchronous code look more synchronous, and provide a comparative example.

items.display: Explain the MVC architectural pattern
items.prompt: Explain the roles and responsibilities of each part in the Model-View-Controller (MVC) architectural pattern, and how they interact with each other. Use a web application as an example to illustrate the MVC workflow.

items.display: Implement a Singleton design pattern
items.prompt: Explain what the Singleton design pattern is and its use cases. Implement a thread-safe Singleton pattern in Java or Python and discuss the pros and cons of different implementation approaches (e.g., lazy vs. eager initialization).

items.display: What is a database index?
items.prompt: Explain the purpose, principles, and advantages of a database index. Discuss the drawbacks of indexes (e.g., overhead on write operations) and explain how a B-Tree index works.

items.display: What is CI/CD?
items.prompt: Explain the concepts of Continuous Integration (CI) and Continuous Delivery/Deployment (CD). Describe the stages a typical CI/CD pipeline consists of (e.g., build, test, deploy).

items.display: Compare SQL and NoSQL databases
items.prompt: Compare relational (SQL) and non-relational (NoSQL) databases in terms of their data models, scalability, consistency, and use cases. List two popular database products for each type.

items.display: Implement a Flexbox layout with CSS
items.prompt: Explain the main concepts of Flexbox layout (e.g., container, items, main axis, cross axis). Provide a code example to demonstrate how to use Flexbox to create a centered, responsive navigation bar.

items.display: What is HTTPS? How does it work?
items.prompt: Explain the advantages of HTTPS over HTTP. Briefly describe the SSL/TLS handshake process, including the steps of key exchange, certificate validation, and data encryption.

items.display: Explain the Binary Search algorithm
items.prompt: Explain the principle of the binary search algorithm and its prerequisite (a sorted array). Implement the algorithm in Python or Java and analyze its time complexity.

items.display: What is OAuth 2.0?
items.prompt: Use a common example (e.g., 'Log in with Google on a third-party app') to explain the OAuth 2.0 authorization flow. Describe the roles involved (e.g., resource owner, client, authorization server).

items.display: Implement a Publish-Subscribe pattern
items.prompt: Explain the Publish-Subscribe design pattern. Implement a simple event bus in JavaScript or Python that includes `on`, `off`, and `emit` methods.

items.display: What is the CAP Theorem?
items.prompt: Explain the CAP theorem in distributed system design: Consistency, Availability, and Partition tolerance. Explain why in a distributed system, we often have to make a trade-off between C and A.

items.display: Explain the difference between a process and a thread
items.prompt: Compare processes and threads in detail, covering their definitions, resource allocation, context switching overhead, and communication methods.

items.display: What is DNS? How does it resolve a domain name?
items.prompt: Explain the role of the Domain Name System (DNS). Describe the complete process of a DNS query, from the browser cache to the recursive query process involving root name servers.

items.display: Implement Fibonacci sequence in several ways
items.prompt: Please use recursion, iteration, and dynamic programming (memoization) to calculate the nth term of the Fibonacci sequence. Compare the time and space complexity of these three methods.

items.display: Explain XSS (Cross-Site Scripting)
items.prompt: Explain what an XSS attack is, including the differences between stored, reflected, and DOM-based XSS. Illustrate the attack principle with an example and provide effective prevention measures.

items.display: What is Load Balancing?
items.prompt: Explain the concept and purpose of Load Balancing. Introduce several common load balancing algorithms, such as Round Robin, Least Connections, and IP Hash.

items.display: What are closures in JavaScript?
items.prompt: Use a clear example to explain what a closure is in JavaScript and how it is formed. Discuss common use cases for closures and potential memory leak issues.

items.display: Implement a graph's Depth-First Search (DFS)
items.prompt: Explain the idea behind the Depth-First Search (DFS) algorithm. Represent a graph using an adjacency list and implement DFS in Python or Java, both recursively and non-recursively (using a stack).

items.display: What is a RESTful API design style?
items.prompt: Explain the main principles of REST (Representational State Transfer), such as statelessness, client-server architecture, and a uniform interface. Describe how to use HTTP verbs (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE) to design resource operations.

items.display: Explain the Merge Sort algorithm
items.prompt: Explain the 'divide and conquer' strategy of Merge Sort. Implement the algorithm in Python or Java and analyze its stability and time complexity.

items.display: What is Dependency Injection (DI)?
items.prompt: Explain what Dependency Injection (DI) and Inversion of Control (IoC) are. Use a simple example to show how DI helps reduce code coupling and improve testability.

items.display: Explain the role of Webpack
items.prompt: Explain the core functionalities of the module bundler Webpack, such as module bundling, code transformation (loaders), and the plugin system. Describe what a basic webpack configuration file contains.

items.display: Implement a simple Hash Table
items.prompt: Explain how a Hash Table works, including the hash function and collision resolution methods (like chaining). Implement a simple hash table with put, get, and delete operations in Python or Java.

items.display: What is CSRF (Cross-Site Request Forgery)?
items.prompt: Explain the principle of a CSRF attack and provide an example of how a user can be exploited by an attacker without their knowledge. List and explain several effective defense strategies, such as using CSRF tokens.

items.display: Explain the meaning of HTTP status codes
items.prompt: Categorize and explain common HTTP status codes: 1xx (Informational), 2xx (Success), 3xx (Redirection), 4xx (Client Error), 5xx (Server Error). Provide two specific examples for each category (e.g., 200, 201, 301, 404, 500).

items.display: What is a microservices architecture?
items.prompt: Explain the core idea of a microservices architecture and compare it with a monolithic architecture, analyzing its pros and cons in terms of development, deployment, scalability, and fault tolerance.

items.display: Explain Goroutines in Go
items.prompt: Explain what Goroutines are in the Go language and how they differ from traditional threads. Use a simple concurrent code example to show how to create and use Goroutines and Channels for communication.

items.display: What is TDD (Test-Driven Development)?
items.prompt: Explain the 'Red-Green-Refactor' cycle of Test-Driven Development (TDD). Describe the benefits that TDD brings to code quality and software design.

items.display: Explain prototype chain and prototypal inheritance
items.prompt: Explain in detail the concepts of prototype, `__proto__`, and prototype chain in JavaScript. Demonstrate how to implement prototype-based inheritance with a code example.

items.display: Compare Sass and Less
items.prompt: Compare the two CSS preprocessors, Sass and Less, in terms of syntax, variables, mixins, inheritance, and functions. Discuss their pros, cons, and community ecosystems.

items.display: What is a CDN?
items.prompt: Explain how a Content Delivery Network (CDN) works and why it can speed up website access. Describe how a CDN reduces latency through edge node caching and proximity-based access.

items.display: Explain the Observer design pattern
items.prompt: Explain the intent and structure of the Observer design pattern (Subject and Observer). Implement a simple Observer pattern example in Java or Python.

items.display: What are WebSockets?
items.prompt: Explain the difference between the WebSocket protocol and the HTTP protocol, and how it enables full-duplex communication between the server and the client. Describe suitable application scenarios for WebSockets.

items.display: Implement a level-order traversal of a binary tree
items.prompt: Explain what a level-order traversal of a binary tree is. Use a queue as an auxiliary data structure to implement the level-order traversal algorithm in Python or Java.

items.display: Explain the ACID properties of database transactions
items.prompt: Explain in detail the four ACID properties of database transactions: Atomicity, Consistency, Isolation, and Durability.

items.display: What is a deadlock? How to avoid it?
items.prompt: Explain what a deadlock is and the four necessary conditions for its occurrence. Discuss strategies for preventing and avoiding deadlocks, such as ordered resource allocation.

items.display: Explain the reactivity system in Vue.js
items.prompt: Briefly explain the principles of how data reactivity is implemented in Vue 2.x using `Object.defineProperty` and in Vue 3.x using `Proxy`. Describe the pros and cons of each.

items.display: What is an API Gateway?
items.prompt: Explain the role of an API Gateway in a microservices architecture, such as routing, authentication, monitoring, and rate limiting. Discuss the pros and cons of using an API Gateway.

items.display: Write a regex to validate an email address
items.prompt: Write a regular expression to validate common email address formats. Please explain the components of the regex and mention edge cases it might not cover.

items.display: Explain the TCP three-way handshake
items.prompt: Describe in detail the three-way handshake process for establishing a TCP connection, including the exchange of SYN, SYN-ACK, and ACK packets. Explain the purpose of each handshake.

items.display: What is WebAssembly (Wasm)?
items.prompt: Explain what WebAssembly is and why it was created. Discuss the advantages of Wasm (e.g., performance, portability) and how it works with JavaScript.

items.display: Explain the Factory Method design pattern
items.prompt: Explain the definition and purpose of the Factory Method design pattern. Use a code example to show how it delegates object creation to subclasses, thereby increasing system extensibility.

items.display: Compare Cookie, localStorage, and sessionStorage
items.prompt: Compare the browser-side storage solutions `Cookie`, `localStorage`, and `sessionStorage` in detail, covering data size, lifecycle, scope, and communication with the server.

items.display: Implement a Trie (Prefix Tree)
items.prompt: Explain the principle and use cases of the Trie (prefix tree) data structure (e.g., autocomplete). Implement a Trie in Python or Java with methods for inserting words and searching for prefixes.

items.display: Draft a speech on environmental protection
items.prompt: Please write a 5-minute speech for an event on World Environment Day about 'Reducing Plastic Pollution'. The tone should be passionate and powerful, aiming to awaken the audience's environmental consciousness.

items.display: Create an event plan for a company team-building day
items.prompt: Develop a detailed one-day team-building plan for a 50-person tech company. The activities should be fun, enhance team cohesion, and include a detailed budget and schedule.

items.display: Write a quarterly work report and plan for the next quarter
items.prompt: As a product manager, write a personal work summary for the current quarter, highlighting completed projects and data-driven results, and create a detailed work plan (OKRs) for the next quarter.

items.display: Outline a PPT on the future of AI
items.prompt: Create a PPT outline for a presentation on 'How AI is Changing Our Lives', aimed at a non-technical audience.

items.display: Write a short video script for a travel vlog
items.prompt: Write a script for a 3-minute travel vlog about a trip to Bali, including an opening, commentary for various scenes, transition ideas, and a closing. The style should be relaxed and cheerful.

items.display: Compose a Xiaohongshu post for a new beauty product
items.prompt: Write a Xiaohongshu post for a new face cream that focuses on 'hydration and repair'. It should include a catchy title, a review of your user experience, an analysis of the ingredients, and descriptions for before-and-after pictures.

items.display: Write a WeChat Moments post to announce a new coffee shop
items.prompt: Draft three different WeChat Moments posts to promote a new specialty coffee shop in the neighborhood, focusing on the grand opening discount, the cafe's atmosphere, and the unique coffee beans, respectively. Suggest accompanying images for each.

items.display: Write an 800-word essay on the topic of 'Summer'
items.prompt: Write an 800-word narrative essay titled 'The Summer I Remember', including vivid descriptions of scenery and sincere emotional expression.

items.display: Draft a business partnership invitation email
items.prompt: Our company is an EdTech firm, and we want to collaborate with a well-known publisher to develop online courses. Please draft a formal business partnership invitation email.

items.display: Write a cover letter for a job application
items.prompt: You are applying for a 'Marketing Manager' position. Write a cover letter that highlights your relevant experience and skills according to the job requirements.

items.display: Compose a movie review for 'Interstellar'
items.prompt: Write an in-depth movie review of 'Interstellar' of at least 1000 words, focusing on its plot, visual effects, and emotional core.

items.display: Write a press release for a new product launch
items.prompt: Write a press release for the launch of a new generation drone, intended for major tech media outlets. The release should include key information such as product highlights, price, and release date.

items.display: Outline a presentation on 'Digital Transformation'
items.prompt: Design a PPT outline for a training session on 'Corporate Digital Transformation' for middle managers. The content should cover the necessity of transformation, key areas, implementation paths, and success stories.

items.display: Write a blog post on 'How to Overcome Procrastination'
items.prompt: Write a practical blog post on how to overcome procrastination. The article should provide at least five concrete, actionable methods, explained with reference to psychological principles.

items.display: Create a world-building backstory for a game
items.prompt: I'm developing an RPG set in a steampunk world where magic and machinery coexist. Please create a grand world-building backstory for this game.

items.display: Perimeter of a square with 4cm sides
items.prompt: Calculate the perimeter of a square with 4cm sides using geometric formulas, and explain the general calculation formula for square perimeters.

items.display: Simplest fraction greater than 3/5 (denominator ≤10)
items.prompt: List all simplest fractions with denominators ≤10 that are greater than 3/5, demonstrating the comparison process and verifying simplification conditions.

items.display: 0.999... vs 1: Which is larger? Prove it
items.prompt: Prove 0.999... equals 1 using three methods (algebraic derivation, limit definition, fractional conversion), and explain the mathematical essence of infinite repeating decimals.

items.display: Probability of two heads given at least one head
items.prompt: Calculate the probability of getting two heads in two coin tosses given at least one head, using conditional probability formula and complete probability space analysis.

items.display: Tiling 3×8 floor with 1×2 tiles
items.prompt: Calculate the number of ways to tile a 3×8 grid using 1×2 tiles via recursive relations or dynamic programming, showing computational steps.

items.display: Compound interest: Years to double at 5% monthly
items.prompt: Calculate the time required for principal to double at 5% annual interest compounded monthly, providing month-precise results and derivation.

items.display: Solving 5x ≡ 7 (mod 12)
items.prompt: Solve the congruence equation 5x ≡ 7 mod 12 using multiplicative inverse method, with complete steps and solution verification.

items.display: Neural network connections in binary
items.prompt: Calculate total connection methods for a neural network with 3 input, 4 hidden, and 2 output layers, detailing weight calculations between layers (3×4 and 4×2).

items.display: Clock angle at 3:15
items.prompt: Calculate the precise angle between hour and minute hands at 3:15 using clock angle formulas, explaining hour-hand movement speed.

items.display: Coffee cup vs donut in topology
items.prompt: Explain the topological equivalence between coffee cups and donuts through homeomorphism and genus concepts, describing continuous deformation processes.

items.display: Explain the Pigeonhole Principle
items.prompt: Explain the Pigeonhole Principle with a simple example and its applications.

items.display: Prove the Pythagorean Theorem
items.prompt: Provide at least two different proofs for the Pythagorean Theorem (a²+b²=c²), for example, using area-based or algebraic methods.

items.display: Explain Euler's Formula V-E+F=2
items.prompt: Explain Euler's formula for polyhedra (Vertices - Edges + Faces = 2) and verify it using a cube and a tetrahedron as examples.

items.display: What is the Golden Ratio?
items.prompt: Explain the definition of the Golden Ratio (approximately 1.618) and provide examples of its application in nature, art, and architecture.

items.display: General formula for the Fibonacci sequence
items.prompt: Write down the general term formula for the Fibonacci sequence (Binet's formula) and use it to calculate the 10th Fibonacci number.

items.display: Explain the Monty Hall problem
items.prompt: Explain the classic Monty Hall problem in detail and clarify why switching doors has a higher probability of winning than sticking with the initial choice.

items.display: Solve a quadratic equation
items.prompt: Provide the quadratic formula for solving equations of the form ax² + bx + c = 0, and use it to solve 2x² - 5x + 3 = 0.

items.display: Calculate the area and circumference of a circle
items.prompt: Write down the formulas for the area (A = πr²) and circumference (C = 2πr) of a circle, and calculate them for a circle with a radius of 5 cm.

items.display: Explain logarithms and their properties
items.prompt: Explain what a logarithm is and its basic properties (e.g., product, quotient, and power rules).

items.display: The Fundamental Theorem of Calculus
items.prompt: Explain the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus in plain language, describing the relationship between definite and indefinite integrals.

items.display: What is the geometric meaning of the derivative?
items.prompt: Explain that the derivative geometrically represents the slope of the tangent line to a function's graph at a point. Find the derivative and the tangent line equation for f(x) = x² at x=2.

items.display: How to perform matrix multiplication
items.prompt: Explain the rules and conditions for multiplying two matrices, and calculate the product of two 2x2 matrices.

items.display: Calculate the determinant of a 3x3 matrix
items.prompt: Provide the method for calculating the determinant of a 3x3 matrix (e.g., the rule of Sarrus) and compute the determinant for a specific 3x3 matrix.

items.display: Dot product and cross product of vectors
items.prompt: Explain the definitions, geometric interpretations, and calculation methods for the dot product and cross product of vectors in three-dimensional space.

items.display: Explain Bayes' Theorem
items.prompt: Write down Bayes' theorem formula and explain its application using a medical diagnosis example (e.g., testing for a disease).

items.display: What is a normal distribution?
items.prompt: Explain the characteristics of the normal distribution (Gaussian distribution), such as its bell shape and symmetry, and its importance in statistics.

items.display: Explain the Least Squares Method
items.prompt: Use a linear regression example to explain the basic idea of the least squares method, i.e., how to find a line that best fits a set of data points.

items.display: The ε-δ definition of a limit
items.prompt: Explain the formal ε-δ definition of a function's limit and use it to prove a simple limit, such as lim(x→2) (3x-1) = 5.

items.display: Taylor series expansion
items.prompt: Explain what a Taylor series is and how it approximates a function using information from the function's derivatives at a single point. Write out the Taylor expansion for e^x at x=0.

items.display: What is a Fourier Transform?
items.prompt: Explain in plain language the basic idea of the Fourier Transform, which is how to decompose a function or signal into a sum of sine and cosine waves of different frequencies.

items.display: Explain irrational numbers
items.prompt: Explain what irrational numbers are (non-repeating, non-terminating decimals) and give three examples (e.g., π, e, √2).

items.display: Prove that the square root of 2 is irrational
items.prompt: Provide a detailed proof by contradiction showing that the square root of 2 is an irrational number.

items.display: Euclidean algorithm for GCD
items.prompt: Explain the principle of the Euclidean algorithm and use it to find the greatest common divisor (GCD) of 1071 and 462.

items.display: Explain the Chinese Remainder Theorem
items.prompt: Use a classic example (like the 'Sun-Tzu problem') to explain the Chinese Remainder Theorem and how it solves a system of congruence equations.

items.display: Difference between Permutations and Combinations
items.prompt: Explain the difference between permutations and combinations, and calculate the number of permutations and combinations of choosing 3 elements from a set of 5.

items.display: What is Expected Value?
items.prompt: Explain the concept of the expected value of a random variable in probability theory, and calculate the expected value of rolling a single six-sided die.

items.display: Meaning of Standard Deviation and Variance
items.prompt: Explain variance and standard deviation as statistical measures of data dispersion, their calculation formulas, and their differences.

items.display: Linear Independence and Dependence
items.prompt: In linear algebra, explain the definitions of a set of vectors being linearly dependent or independent, and provide an example.

items.display: What are Eigenvalues and Eigenvectors?
items.prompt: Explain the definition and geometric meaning of a matrix's eigenvalues and eigenvectors (vectors that do not change direction after a linear transformation).

items.display: Basic concepts of Group Theory
items.prompt: Explain the four fundamental axioms of a group (closure, associativity, identity element, inverse element) and provide a simple example of a group (e.g., the integers under addition).

items.display: What is the Riemann Hypothesis?
items.prompt: Introduce the core idea of the Riemann Hypothesis in simple terms, regarding the distribution of the non-trivial zeros of the Riemann Zeta function.

items.display: Explain the Four Color Theorem
items.prompt: Introduce the content of the Four Color Theorem (any map can be colored with no more than four colors such that no two adjacent regions have the same color) and its significance in computer-assisted proofs.

items.display: Fermat's Last Theorem
items.prompt: Introduce the content of Fermat's Last Theorem (for an integer n > 2, the equation xⁿ + yⁿ = zⁿ has no positive integer solutions) and a brief history of its proof.

items.display: Gödel's Incompleteness Theorems
items.prompt: Explain in plain language the meaning of Gödel's Incompleteness Theorems, which state that any sufficiently complex mathematical system contains propositions that cannot be proven or disproven.

items.display: What are fractals?
items.prompt: Explain the self-similarity characteristic of fractals and provide some famous examples, such as the Mandelbrot set or the Koch snowflake.

items.display: Explain Nash Equilibrium
items.prompt: Explain the concept of Nash Equilibrium in game theory using the 'Prisoner's Dilemma' as an example.

items.display: Introduction to Differential Equations
items.prompt: Explain what a differential equation is and its role in describing dynamic systems in fields like physics, engineering, and economics. Give a simple example.

items.display: What are Partial Derivatives?
items.prompt: Explain the concept of partial derivatives in multivariable calculus, which is the instantaneous rate of change of a function with respect to one variable while others are held constant.

items.display: Lagrange Mean Value Theorem
items.prompt: Explain the geometric meaning of the Lagrange Mean Value Theorem, which states that on a smooth curve, there is a point whose tangent is parallel to the secant line between two points.

items.display: Cauchy-Schwarz Inequality
items.prompt: Write down the vector form of the Cauchy-Schwarz inequality and explain its geometric interpretation.

items.display: Why can't sound travel in space
items.prompt: Explain why sound waves cannot propagate in space vacuum based on wave physics principles, comparing electromagnetic vs mechanical wave propagation.

items.display: Why marker ink doesn't dissolve in water
items.prompt: Analyze chemical differences between oil-based markers and watercolors, explaining hydrophobic properties from molecular structure perspectives.

items.display: Why summer air appears clearer
items.prompt: Explain high daytime visibility in summer using atmospheric scattering principles (Rayleigh/Mie scattering) and seasonal particulate variations.

items.display: Why stars twinkle
items.prompt: Explain stellar scintillation through atmospheric turbulence theory, detailing temperature gradient effects on refractive index and astronomical seeing.

items.display: Nighttime glacier melting paradox
items.prompt: Clarify misconceptions about glacier melt by analyzing energy conservation factors and radiative cooling effects on glacial ablation.

items.display: Spider silk strength
items.prompt: Analyze spider silk's molecular structure from biomaterials perspective, explaining how β-sheet crystallites confer strength and elasticity.

items.display: Cause of seasons
items.prompt: Explain seasonal changes through Earth's orbital mechanics and axial tilt (23.5°), detailing solar declination shifts and hemispheric differences.

items.display: Tarot Reader
items.prompt: I request you to act as a tarot reader. You will answer my questions using virtual tarot cards. Don't forget to shuffle and introduce the deck used. Ask if I want to draw 3 cards myself. If not, draw random cards. Explain card meanings, temporal associations (past/present/future), and provide actionable advice related to my financial situation.

items.display: Music Recommender
items.prompt: Act as a song recommender. Create a 10-song playlist similar to my given track. Provide playlist name/description without repeating artist names. First song: 'Other Lives - Epic'.

items.display: Drunk Person
items.prompt: Simulate a drunk person's texting style with intentional grammar/spelling errors and random topic shifts. First message: 'How r u?'

items.display: Product Manager
items.prompt: Act as a PM. Help draft PRD documents containing: Title, Introduction, Problem Statement, Goals, User Stories, Tech Requirements, Benefits, KPIs, Risks, Conclusion. Wait for specific topics before writing.

items.display: CEO
items.prompt: Act as CEO of a hypothetical company. Address product recall crises by making strategic decisions to mitigate brand impact while protecting stakeholders.

items.display: Salesperson
items.prompt: Roleplay as a salesperson pitching over-sold products via simulated cold call: 'Hello, may I ask the purpose of your call?'

items.display: Magic Conch Shell
items.prompt: Respond as SpongeBob's Magic Conch using only: 'Maybe someday', 'I don't think so', or 'Try asking again'. First question: 'Should I go jellyfishing today?'
